introText: Collaborate with me to take your business online and boost its growth.
mainTitle: Empower Your Business to Thrive Online

about.title: About Me
about.subtitle: Innovative Web Developer and Tech Enthusiast
description: I am a Computer Science and Engineering graduate with a strong passion for web development. Throughout my academic journey, I developed a keen interest in this field, often implementing my academic projects as web applications. This hands-on experience allowed me to deepen my understanding of web technologies and foster a continuous drive for self-improvement. I possess expertise in both frontend and backend development, with a particular proficiency in React.js for creating dynamic user interfaces. On the backend, I utilize the Flask framework to build robust applications. Additionally, I have knowledge of PHP Laravel and Ruby on Rails, which enables me to adapt to various project requirements and frameworks.My skills extend beyond frameworks; I am well-versed in the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and adept at designing database structures. I can effectively manipulate databases using SQL and MySQL and am proficient in creating Entity-Relationship Diagrams (ERD) and applying normalization techniques to ensure optimal database design.I am committed to leveraging my skills and knowledge to contribute to innovative web solutions while continually seeking opportunities to enhance my expertise in the ever-evolving tech landscape.

projects.title: Project 1: Food Oder System
projects.description: As part of my academic coursework for CSE307, I developed a comprehensive web application that simulates a food ordering platform similar to Foodpanda. The frontend was built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, while PHP and MySQL were used for backend development. The platform includes a range of user features, allowing users to sign up, log in, browse restaurant menus, place orders online, and provide feedback about the food and restaurants. Additionally, the system offers robust restaurant features, enabling multiple restaurants to create accounts, manage their menus, and efficiently process customer orders.

projects.title: Project 2: Student Management System
projects.description: As part of my academic coursework for Database Management Systems (CSE303), I participated in a project aimed at enhancing an existing Student Management System. The frontend was developed using HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, and JavaScript, with PHP and MySQL used for the backend. The project involved several key steps, starting with a thorough problem analysis to identify issues and propose solutions for the newly presented challenges within the system. A rich picture was created to visually represent the system's processes and interactions, followed by the formulation of detailed business rules to ensure consistent operations. I also designed an Entity-Relationship Diagram (ERD) to illustrate relationships between entities within the system, and finally, I developed a database schema, performing normalization to optimize the structure for efficiency.

projects.title: Project 3: Shipyard Company
projects.description: As part of my academic coursework for Object-Oriented Programming (CSE213), I participated in a team-based project focused on developing a system for a ShipYard Company using Java and JavaFX. The project began with the selection of the ShipYard Company as the primary focus. Each team member identified two specific users within the system and defined eight key goals for each user, outlining their roles and objectives. We then created UML diagrams for each user, which were later merged into a comprehensive system model. The implementation was done in Java, applying Object-Oriented Programming principles to ensure the system was modular, reusable, and scalable. Additionally, we developed the user interface using SceneBuilder and integrated it with the Java code to provide a seamless and intuitive user experience.

projects.title: Project 4: Website for a Restaurant
projects.description: During my internship, I developed a restaurant website as part of a task to enhance my React.js skills. The project involved replicating an existing website provided by my supervisor. Key aspects of the project included accurately mimicking both the design and functionality of the specified website to practice React.js development. I utilized various React libraries such as AOS (Animate On Scroll), React Router, and React Icons to incorporate smooth animations and interactive features. The content was dynamically integrated from a JSON file, ensuring a structured and maintainable approach. Additionally, I focused on implementing a fully responsive design using Tailwind CSS, ensuring an optimal user experience across all devices and screen sizes.

projects.title: Project 5: Appointment_shedule_Chat_bot
projects.description: During my internship, I developed the frontend of an Appointment Schedule Chat Bot for a client, based on a Figma design provided by my supervisor. Key aspects of the project included accurately replicating the design from the Figma file, ensuring that the final product adhered closely to the client's specifications. I also focused on ensuring the application was fully responsive, delivering an optimal user experience across different devices. For the frontend development, I utilized React.js and Tailwind CSS, emphasizing clean, maintainable code and efficient performance.

projects.title: Project 6: Tour Guide App
projects.description: For my System Analysis and Design course, I developed a comprehensive project focused on analyzing and solving a specific problem within the tour guiding industry. The project began with identifying and thoroughly researching the problem, including a review of relevant articles and academic papers to gain a deeper understanding of the industry's challenges. I conducted a detailed problem analysis to identify the core issues and proposed an optimal solution using various system design techniques.To support the design, I created a series of detailed diagrams and documentation, which helped in visualizing the solution. Additionally, I conducted interviews and surveys to gather further insights and data, enriching the analysis and informing the final system design.

projects.title: Project 7: Blog app using Flask
projects.description: To enhance my backend development skills, I undertook a project using the Flask framework, with the frontend built using HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap. The application focuses on implementing comprehensive CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations. For user management, I implemented functionalities that allow for the creation, updating, and deletion of user records. Similarly, post management features enable users to create, update, and delete posts, with the added functionality of searching for posts by ID and viewing specific post details. The frontend was designed to be responsive and user-friendly, leveraging HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap. On the backend, Flask was used to handle server-side logic, while SQLAlchemy was employed for database management, providing an efficient Object-Relational Mapping (ORM) solution.

projects.title: Project 8: E-ommerce Webapp
projects.description: I developed a project using React.js, Tailwind CSS, and the Context API, with local storage for data persistence. The UI design was based on a Figma prototype that I meticulously replicated. Key features of the application include user authentication, allowing users to sign up and log in to the system. Logged-in users can browse and purchase products seamlessly. The application also includes robust cart functionality, enabling users to add products to their cart and adjust quantities by increasing or decreasing items as needed. To effectively manage application state and ensure user data persists across sessions, I utilized the Context API along with local storage.

experiences.title: Software Developer Internship
experiences.description: I completed three months internship in this company.Within these three months i learned React Js tailwindCss and Typescript for frontend and python , flask for backend development.

experiences.title: Web Developer Internship(Part time)
experiences.description: I completed remote internship in this company for three months.Within these three months they taught me Ruby on Rails, Wordpress and shopify.They assigned a teacher to teach me ruby on rails and provide a udemy course for wordpress.

experiences.title: Director of Competitive Programming
experiences.description: As the Director of Competitive Programming for one year, I was responsible for facilitating communication between students and faculty regarding competitive programming practice sessions organized by our esteemed faculty, acting as an intermediary to ensure effective dissemination of information. Additionally, I arranged and oversaw competitive programming competitions each semester to encourage participation and skill development among members. My role also involved actively participating in all club events to support and promote the chapter's activities and objectives, while representing the chapter in departmental events and contributing to the broader academic and extracurricular community.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Engineering
education.description: Graduated with a focus on software development, data structures, algorithms, and system design and analysis. Actively participated in coding challenges, group projects, and was a member of the ACM Student Chapter.
Completed with a major in Science, focusing on Mathematics, Physics, and Computer Science. Graduated with distinction and participated in science fairs and extracurricular clubs.
